info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 3:18PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Choctaw, northern Mobile, northwestern Baldwin, Washington, southwestern Clarke, eastern Wayne and northeastern Greene Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 318 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northeast of Waynesboro to 14 miles northwest of McCullough. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Citronelle, Chatom, Saint Stephens, Wagarville, Leroy, Deer Park, Tibbie, Calvert, Mount Vernon, Millry, State Line, Buckatunna, Silas, Fruitdale and McIntosh. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
